interface.guard:
${FUNCTION_PREFIX}_${FUNCTION_PREFIX}${STUB_PREFIX}_H_INCLUDED
stdbool.h stddef.h stdint.h
__cplusplusextern "C"
/// @addtogroup ${function_prefix} /// @{
${FUNCTION_PREFIX}_MAJOR_VERSION0 ${Function_Prefix} major version number. ${FUNCTION_PREFIX}_MINOR_VERSION79 ${Function_Prefix} minor version number. ${FUNCTION_PREFIX}_PATCH_VERSION0 ${Function_Prefix} patch version number. ${FUNCTION_PREFIX}_VERSION (((uint32_t)${FUNCTION_PREFIX}_MAJOR_VERSION << 22) | ((uint32_t)${FUNCTION_PREFIX}_MINOR_VERSION << 12) | ((uint32_t)${FUNCTION_PREFIX}_PATCH_VERSION)) ${Function_Prefix} combined version number.
${PREFIX}_NULL_ID0 Default value for initializing ${Prefix} object `id` member variable.
${prefix}_result_tint32_t A result code type. The return code from our ${Prefix} functions. ${prefix}_result_e
${prefix}_id_tuint32_t Declare ${Prefix}'s combined identifier type. ${prefix}_object_id_tuint32_t Declare ${Prefix}'s object identifier type. ${prefix}_target_id_tuint32_t Declare ${Prefix}'s target identifier type. ${prefix}_command_id_tuint32_t Declare ${Prefix}'s command identifier type. ${prefix}_device_info_t*${prefix}_device_info_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s device information container. ${prefix}_device_t*${prefix}_device_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s device container. ${prefix}_memory_t*${prefix}_memory_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s memory container. ${prefix}_buffer_t*${prefix}_buffer_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s buffer container. ${prefix}_offset_3d_t${prefix}_offset_3d_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s three dimensional offset. ${prefix}_extent_3d_t${prefix}_extent_3d_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s three dimensional extent. ${prefix}_extent_2d_t${prefix}_extent_2d_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s two dimensional extent. ${prefix}_image_t*${prefix}_image_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s image container.
${prefix}_sampler_t${prefix}_sampler_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s sampler container. ${prefix}_queue_t*${prefix}_queue_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s queue container. ${prefix}_command_buffer_t*${prefix}_command_buffer_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s command buffer container. ${prefix}_semaphore_t*${prefix}_semaphore_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s semaphore container. ${prefix}_fence_t*${prefix}_fence_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s fence container. ${prefix}_sync_point_t*${prefix}_sync_point_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s sync-point container. ${prefix}_executable_t*${prefix}_executable_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s executable container. ${prefix}_kernel_t*${prefix}_kernel_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s kernel container. ${prefix}_query_pool_t*${prefix}_query_pool_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s query pool container. ${prefix}_query_counter_t${prefix}_query_counter_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s query counter container. ${prefix}_query_counter_description_t${prefix}_query_counter_description_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s query counter description container. ${prefix}_query_counter_config_t${prefix}_query_counter_config_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s query counter configuration container. ${prefix}_query_duration_result_t*${prefix}_query_duration_result_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s duration query result container. ${prefix}_query_counter_result_t*${prefix}_query_counter_result_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s counter query result container. ${prefix}_allocator_info_t${prefix}_allocator_info_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s allocator container. ${prefix}_callback_info_t*${prefix}_callback_info_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s callback container. ${prefix}_descriptor_info_t${prefix}_descriptor_info_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s descriptor container. ${prefix}_buffer_region_info_t${prefix}_buffer_region_info_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s buffer region container. ${prefix}_ndrange_options_t${prefix}_ndrange_options_s Forward declare ${Prefix}'s kernel execution options container.
${prefix}_result_e
${prefix}_success0 No error occurred. ${prefix}_error_failure1 An unknown error occurred. ${prefix}_error_null_out_parameter2 An out parameter (EG. a pointer argument) was null when it should not be. ${prefix}_error_invalid_value3 An invalid parameter was provided. ${prefix}_error_out_of_memory4 An allocation failed. ${prefix}_error_null_allocator_callback5 An allocator callback provided to ${Prefix} was null. ${prefix}_error_device_entry_hook_failed6 A device entry hook was malformed. ${prefix}_error_invalid_binary7 A file was an invalid binary. ${prefix}_error_feature_unsupported8 Feature is unsupported by ${Prefix} API. ${prefix}_error_missing_kernel9 Kernel was not found. ${prefix}_error_internal10 An internal error has occurred, this should never happen. Use this in place of assertions. ${prefix}_error_fence_failure11 A fence waited upon failed. ${prefix}_fence_not_ready12 A fence waited upon was not yet complete.
All ${Prefix} result types. Used as the return codes from our ${Prefix} functions, to denote whether the function was successful.
1
${prefix}_object_id_e
${prefix}_object_id_buffer(1 << 16) ID for `::${prefix}_buffer_t` objects. ${prefix}_object_id_command_buffer(2 << 16) ID for `::${prefix}_command_buffer_t` objects. ${prefix}_object_id_device(3 << 16) ID for `::${prefix}_device_t` objects. ${prefix}_object_id_executable(4 << 16) ID for `::${prefix}_executable_t` objects. ${prefix}_object_id_image(5 << 16) ID for `::${prefix}_image_t` objects. ${prefix}_object_id_kernel(6 << 16) ID for `::${prefix}_kernel_t` objects. ${prefix}_object_id_memory(7 << 16) ID for `::${prefix}_memory_t` objects. ${prefix}_object_id_queue(8 << 16) ID for `::${prefix}_queue_t` objects. ${prefix}_object_id_sampler(9 << 16) ID for `::${prefix}_sampler_t` objects. ${prefix}_object_id_semaphore(10 << 16) ID for `::${prefix}_semaphore_t` objects. ${prefix}_object_id_query_pool(11 << 16) ID for `::${prefix}_query_pool_t` objects. ${prefix}_object_id_sync_point(12 << 16) ID for `::${prefix}_sync_point_t` objects. ${prefix}_object_id_fence(13 << 16) ID for `::${prefix}_fence_t` objects. ${prefix}_object_id_mask0xffff0000 Mask for ID values which are always help in the upper 16 bits of the 32 bit `::${prefix}_id_t`.
All ${Prefix} object type tags. Type IDs are combined with the generated `${prefix}_target_id_e`, using a bitwise and, to create the value for each ${Prefix} object's `id` member, all `::${prefix}_object_id_e` values are in the upper 16 bits of the 32 bit `::${prefix}_id_t`.
${prefix}_device_type_e
${prefix}_device_type_cpu(0x1 << 0) Device is a CPU. ${prefix}_device_type_gpu_integrated(0x1 << 1) Device is an integrated GPU. ${prefix}_device_type_gpu_discrete(0x1 << 2) Device is a discrete GPU. ${prefix}_device_type_gpu_virtual(0x1 << 3) Device is a virtualized GPU. ${prefix}_device_type_accelerator(0x1 << 4) Device is an accelerator chip. ${prefix}_device_type_custom(0x1 << 5) Device is a mysterious custom type. ${prefix}_device_type_all0xFFFFFFFF Mask to match all device types.
All possible device types. ${prefix}_device_info_s::device_type Used to identify which type an ${Prefix} device is, can be used as a bitfield to select devices by type with `::${prefix}GetDeviceInfos`.
${prefix}_queue_type_e ${prefix}_queue_type_e
${prefix}_queue_type_compute0 A queue type that supports all compute operations. ${prefix}_queue_type_total1 The total number of queue types used.
All possible queue types that can be supported. Used to identify which queue type is required for operations.
@note There exists code that assumes that this enum starts at zero, and that the numbers increment contiguously until ${prefix}_queue_type_total.
${prefix}_allocation_type_e ${prefix}_allocation_type_e
${prefix}_allocation_type_alloc_host0 Allocate pinned memory visible on both host and device. Used in combination with ${prefix}_memory_property_host_coherent or ${prefix}_memory_property_host_cached. ${prefix}_allocation_type_alloc_device1 Allocate device memory. Can be used with ${prefix}_memory_property_device_local or ${prefix}_memory_property_host_visible.
All possible allocation types that can be supported. Used when allocating memory through the ${Prefix} device to specify what allocation type is being requested.
${prefix}_allocation_capabilities_e
${prefix}_allocation_capabilities_coherent_host0x1 << 0 Can an ${Prefix} device allocate cache coherent host memory, or use pre-allocated host memory without synchronization. ${prefix}_allocation_capabilities_cached_host0x1 << 1 Can an ${Prefix} device use host memory with explicit synchronization. ${prefix}_allocation_capabilities_alloc_device0x1 << 2 Can an ${Prefix} device allocate device-only memory.
Bitfield of all possible allocation capabilities. ${prefix}_device_info_s::allocation_capabilities Each ${Prefix} device info struct has a member which denotes the allocation capabilities of that device, as a bitfield of the following enum.
${prefix}_memory_property_e ${prefix}_memory_property_e
${prefix}_memory_property_device_local(0x1 << 1) Memory is visible only on the device and can not be mapped. Must not be used in combination with ${prefix}_memory_property_host_visible, ${prefix}_memory_property_host_coherent, or ${prefix}_memory_property_host_cached. ${prefix}_memory_property_host_visible(0x1 << 2) Memory is visible on host and device, can be mapped using ${prefix}MapMemory. Can be used with ${prefix}_memory_property_host_coherent or ${prefix}_memory_property_host_cached. ${prefix}_memory_property_host_coherent(0x1 << 3) Memory caches are coherent between host and device. No explicit synchronization is required. Can be used with ${prefix}_memory_property_host_visible, is mutually exclusive with ${prefix}_memory_property_host_cached. ${prefix}_memory_property_host_cached(0x1 << 4) Memory caches are not coherent between host and device. Explicit synchronization is required, using ${prefix}MapMemory and ${prefix}UnmapMemory, before updates are visible on host or device. Can be used with ${prefix}_memory_property_host_visible, is mutually exclusive with ${prefix}_memory_property_host_coherent.
Each of the memory properties which may be requested for an allocation.
${prefix}_image_type_e ${prefix}_image_type_e
${prefix}_image_type_1dA 1 dimensional image type. ${prefix}_image_type_2dA 2 dimensional image type. ${prefix}_image_type_3dA 3 dimensional image type. ${prefix}_force_size_image_type0x7fffffffForce enum size to 32 bits
All possible image types that can be supported. Used when creating a ${prefix}_image_t object to specify the dimensionality of the image.
${prefix}_image_tiling_e ${prefix}_image_tiling_e ${prefix}_image_tiling_linear Linear tiling mode lays out pixel data in linear order, this order should be used when transferring data to/from the host. ${prefix}_image_tiling_optimal Optimal tiling mode lays out pixel data in cache friendly order, this mode should be used for best device performance.
All possible image tiling modes an image can be in.
${prefix}_image_format_e ${prefix}_image_format_e
${prefix}_image_format_R8_snorm(0x10B0 | (0x10D0 << 16)) R channel format with 8 signed normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16_snorm(0x10B0 | (0x10D1 << 16)) R channel format with 16 signed normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R8_unorm(0x10B0 | (0x10D2 << 16)) R channel format with 8 unsigned normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16_unorm(0x10B0 | (0x10D3 << 16)) R channel format with 16 unsigned normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R8_sint(0x10B0 | (0x10D7 << 16)) R channel format with 8 signed integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16_sint(0x10B0 | (0x10D8 << 16)) R channel format with 16 signed integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R32_sint(0x10B0 | (0x10D9 << 16)) R channel format with 32 signed integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R8_uint(0x10B0 | (0x10DA << 16)) R channel format with 8 unsigned integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16_uint(0x10B0 | (0x10DB << 16)) R channel format with 16 unsigned integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R32_uint(0x10B0 | (0x10DC << 16)) R channel format with 32 unsigned integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16_sfloat(0x10B0 | (0x10DD << 16)) R channel format with 16 signed floating point bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R32_sfloat(0x10B0 | (0x10DE << 16)) R channel format with 32 signed floating point bits per channel.
${prefix}_image_format_A8_snorm(0x10B1 | (0x10D0 << 16)) A channel format with 8 signed normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_A16_snorm(0x10B1 | (0x10D1 << 16)) A channel format with 16 signed normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_A8_unorm(0x10B1 | (0x10D2 << 16)) A channel format with 8 unsigned normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_A16_unorm(0x10B1 | (0x10D3 << 16)) A channel format with 16 unsigned normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_A8_sint(0x10B1 | (0x10D7 << 16)) A channel format with 8 signed integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_A16_sint(0x10B1 | (0x10D8 << 16)) A channel format with 16 signed integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_A32_sint(0x10B1 | (0x10D9 << 16)) A channel format with 32 signed integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_A8_uint(0x10B1 | (0x10DA << 16)) A channel format with 8 unsigned integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_A16_uint(0x10B1 | (0x10DB << 16)) A channel format with 16 unsigned integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_A32_uint(0x10B1 | (0x10DC << 16)) A channel format with 32 unsigned integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_A16_sfloat(0x10B1 | (0x10DD << 16)) A channel format with 16 signed floating point bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_A32_sfloat(0x10B1 | (0x10DE << 16)) A channel format with 32 signed floating point bits per channel.
${prefix}_image_format_R8G8_snorm(0x10B2 | (0x10D0 << 16)) RG channel format with 8 signed normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16G16_snorm(0x10B2 | (0x10D1 << 16)) RG channel format with 16 signed normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R8G8_unorm(0x10B2 | (0x10D2 << 16)) RG channel format with 8 unsigned normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16G16_unorm(0x10B2 | (0x10D3 << 16)) RG channel format with 16 unsigned normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R8G8_sint(0x10B2 | (0x10D7 << 16)) RG channel format with 8 signed integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16G16_sint(0x10B2 | (0x10D8 << 16)) RG channel format with 16 signed integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R32G32_sint(0x10B2 | (0x10D9 << 16)) RG channel format with 32 signed integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R8G8_uint(0x10B2 | (0x10DA << 16)) RG channel format with 8 unsigned integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16G16_uint(0x10B2 | (0x10DB << 16)) RG channel format with 16 unsigned integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R32G32_uint(0x10B2 | (0x10DC << 16)) RG channel format with 32 unsigned integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16G16_sfloat(0x10B2 | (0x10DD << 16)) RG channel format with 16 signed floating point bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R32G32_sfloat(0x10B2 | (0x10DE << 16)) RG channel format with 32 signed floating point bits per channel.
${prefix}_image_format_R8A8_snorm(0x10B3 | (0x10D0 << 16)) RA channel format with 8 signed normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16A16_snorm(0x10B3 | (0x10D1 << 16)) RA channel format with 16 signed normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R8A8_unorm(0x10B3 | (0x10D2 << 16)) RA channel format with 8 unsigned normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16A16_unorm(0x10B3 | (0x10D3 << 16)) RA channel format with 16 unsigned normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R8A8_sint(0x10B3 | (0x10D7 << 16)) RA channel format with 8 signed integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16A16_sint(0x10B3 | (0x10D8 << 16)) RA channel format with 16 signed integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R32A32_sint(0x10B3 | (0x10D9 << 16)) RA channel format with 32 signed integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R8A8_uint(0x10B3 | (0x10DA << 16)) RA channel format with 8 unsigned integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16A16_uint(0x10B3 | (0x10DB << 16)) RA channel format with 16 unsigned integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R32A32_uint(0x10B3 | (0x10DC << 16)) RA channel format with 32 unsigned integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16A16_sfloat(0x10B3 | (0x10DD << 16)) RA channel format with 16 signed floating point bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R32A32_sfloat(0x10B3 | (0x10DE << 16)) RA channel format with 32 signed floating point bits per channel.
${prefix}_image_format_R5G6B5_unorm_pack16(0x10B4 | (0x10D4 << 16)) RGB channel format with 16 bits of unsigned normalized storage. ${prefix}_image_format_R5G5B5_unorm_pack16(0x10B4 | (0x10D5 << 16)) RGB channel format with 16 bits of unsigned normalized storage. ${prefix}_image_format_R10G10B10_unorm_pack32(0x10B4 | (0x10D6 << 16)) RGB channel format with 32 bits of unsigned normalized storage.
${prefix}_image_format_R8G8B8A8_snorm(0x10B5 | (0x10D0 << 16)) RGBA channel format with 8 signed normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16G16B16A16_snorm(0x10B5 | (0x10D1 << 16)) RGBA channel format with 16 signed normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R8G8B8A8_unorm(0x10B5 | (0x10D2 << 16)) RGBA channel format with 8 unsigned normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16G16B16A16_unorm(0x10B5 | (0x10D3 << 16)) RGBA channel format with 16 unsigned normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R8G8B8A8_sint(0x10B5 | (0x10D7 << 16)) RGBA channel format with 8 signed integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16G16B16A16_sint(0x10B5 | (0x10D8 << 16)) RGBA channel format with 16 signed integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R32G32B32A32_sint(0x10B5 | (0x10D9 << 16)) RGBA channel format with 32 signed integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R8G8B8A8_uint(0x10B5 | (0x10DA << 16)) RGBA channel format with 8 unsigned integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16G16B16A16_uint(0x10B5 | (0x10DB << 16)) RGBA channel format with 16 unsigned integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R32G32B32A32_uint(0x10B5 | (0x10DC << 16)) RGBA channel format with 32 unsigned integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16G16B16A16_sfloat(0x10B5 | (0x10DD << 16)) RGBA channel format with 16 signed floating point bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R32G32B32A32_sfloat(0x10B5 | (0x10DE << 16)) RGBA channel format with 32 signed floating point bits per channel.
${prefix}_image_format_B8G8R8A8_snorm(0x10B6 | (0x10D0 << 16)) BGRA channel format with 8 signed normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_B8G8R8A8_unorm(0x10B6 | (0x10D2 << 16)) BGRA channel format with 8 unsigned normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_B8G8R8A8_sint(0x10B6 | (0x10D7 << 16)) BGRA channel format with 8 signed integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_B8G8R8A8_uint(0x10B6 | (0x10DA << 16)) BGRA channel format with 8 unsigned integer bits per channel.
${prefix}_image_format_A8R8G8B8_snorm(0x10B7 | (0x10D0 << 16)) ARGB channel format with 8 signed normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_A8R8G8B8_unorm(0x10B7 | (0x10D2 << 16)) ARGB channel format with 8 unsigned normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_A8R8G8B8_sint(0x10B7 | (0x10D7 << 16)) ARGB channel format with 8 signed integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_A8R8G8B8_uint(0x10B7 | (0x10DA << 16)) ARGB channel format with 8 unsigned integer bits per channel.
${prefix}_image_format_INTENSITY8_snorm(0x10B8 | (0x10D0 << 16)) Intensity channel format with 8 signed normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_INTENSITY16_snorm(0x10B8 | (0x10D1 << 16)) Intensity channel format with 16 signed normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_INTENSITY8_unorm(0x10B8 | (0x10D2 << 16)) Intensity channel format with 8 unsigned normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_INTENSITY16_unorm(0x10B8 | (0x10D3 << 16)) Intensity channel format with 16 unsigned normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_INTENSITY16_sfloat(0x10B8 | (0x10DD << 16)) Intensity channel format with 16 signed floating point bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_INTENSITY32_sfloat(0x10B8 | (0x10DE << 16)) Intensity channel format with 32 signed floating point bits per channel.
${prefix}_image_format_LUMINANCE8_snorm(0x10B9 | (0x10D0 << 16)) Luminance channel format with 8 signed normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_LUMINANCE16_snorm(0x10B9 | (0x10D1 << 16)) Luminance channel format with 16 signed normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_LUMINANCE8_unorm(0x10B9 | (0x10D2 << 16)) Luminance channel format with 8 unsigned normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_LUMINANCE16_unorm(0x10B9 | (0x10D3 << 16)) Luminance channel format with 16 unsigned normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_LUMINANCE16_sfloat(0x10B9 | (0x10DD << 16)) Luminance channel format with 16 signed floating point bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_LUMINANCE32_sfloat(0x10B9 | (0x10DE << 16)) Luminance channel format with 32 signed floating point bits per channel.
${prefix}_image_format_R8x8_snorm(0x10BA | (0x10D0 << 16)) Rx channel format with 8 signed normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16x16_snorm(0x10BA | (0x10D1 << 16)) Rx channel format with 16 signed normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R8x8_unorm(0x10BA | (0x10D2 << 16)) Rx channel format with 8 unsigned normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16x16_unorm(0x10BA | (0x10D3 << 16)) Rx channel format with 16 unsigned normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R8x8_sint(0x10BA | (0x10D7 << 16)) Rx channel format with 8 signed integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16x16_sint(0x10BA | (0x10D8 << 16)) Rx channel format with 16 signed integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R32x32_sint(0x10BA | (0x10D9 << 16)) Rx channel format with 32 signed integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R8x8_uint(0x10BA | (0x10DA << 16)) Rx channel format with 8 unsigned integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16x16_uint(0x10BA | (0x10DB << 16)) Rx channel format with 16 unsigned integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R32x32_uint(0x10BA | (0x10DC << 16)) Rx channel format with 32 unsigned integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16x16_sfloat(0x10BA | (0x10DD << 16)) Rx channel format with 16 signed floating point bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R32x32_sfloat(0x10BA | (0x10DE << 16)) Rx channel format with 32 signed floating point bits per channel.
${prefix}_image_format_R8G8Bx_snorm(0x10BB | (0x10D0 << 16)) RGx channel format with 8 signed normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16G16B16_snorm(0x10BB | (0x10D1 << 16)) RGx channel format with 16 signed normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R8G8Bx_unorm(0x10BB | (0x10D2 << 16)) RGx channel format with 8 unsigned normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16G16B16_unorm(0x10BB | (0x10D3 << 16)) RGx channel format with 16 unsigned normalized bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R8G8Bx_sint(0x10BB | (0x10D7 << 16)) RGx channel format with 8 signed integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16G16B16_sint(0x10BB | (0x10D8 << 16)) RGx channel format with 16 signed integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R32G32B32_sint(0x10BB | (0x10D9 << 16)) RGx channel format with 32 signed integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R8G8Bx_uint(0x10BB | (0x10DA << 16)) RGx channel format with 8 unsigned integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16G16B16B16_uint(0x10BB | (0x10DB << 16)) RGx channel format with 16 unsigned integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R32G32B32_uint(0x10BB | (0x10DC << 16)) RGx channel format with 32 unsigned integer bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R16G16B16_sfloat(0x10BB | (0x10DD << 16)) RGx channel format with 16 signed floating point bits per channel. ${prefix}_image_format_R32G32B32_sfloat(0x10BB | (0x10DE << 16)) RGx channel format with 32 signed floating point bits per channel.
${prefix}_image_format_R5G6B5x0_unorm_pack16(0x10BC | (0x10D4 << 16)) RGBx channel format with 16 bits of unsigned normalized storage. ${prefix}_image_format_R5G5B5x1_unorm_pack16(0x10BC | (0x10D5 << 16)) RGBx channel format with 16 bits of unsigned normalized storage. ${prefix}_image_format_R10G10B10x2_unorm_pack32(0x10BC | (0x10D6 << 16)) RGBx channel format with 32 bits of unsigned normalized storage.
All possible image formats that can be supported. Used when creating a ::${prefix}_image_t object to specify the pixel data format of the image. The enum values are constructed from the hexadecimal constants specified by OpenCL, the lower 16 bits contains the cl_channel_order value and the upper 16 bits contains the cl_channel_type value.
${prefix}_address_type_e
${prefix}_address_type_logical0 Logical addressing. ${prefix}_address_type_bits321 32-bit wide pointer addressing. ${prefix}_address_type_bits642 64-bit wide pointer addressing.
All possible addressing types that can be used. Used to specify what modes of addressing are supported by the platform.
${prefix}_address_capabilities_e
${prefix}_address_capabilities_logical0x1 << ${prefix}_address_type_logical Logical addressing supported. ${prefix}_address_capabilities_bits320x1 << ${prefix}_address_type_bits32 32-bit wide pointer addressing supported. ${prefix}_address_capabilities_bits640x1 << ${prefix}_address_type_bits64 64-bit wide pointer addressing supported.
Bitfield of all possible addressing capabilities. ${prefix}_device_info_s::source_capabilities Each ${Prefix} device info struct has a member which denotes the addressing capabilities of that device, as a bitfield of the following enum.
${prefix}_cache_capabilities_e
${prefix}_cache_capabilities_read0x1 Read caching supported. ${prefix}_cache_capabilities_write0x2 Write caching supported.
Bitfield of all possible caching capabilities. Each ${Prefix} device struct has a member which denotes the caching capabilities of that device, as a bitfield of the following enum.
${prefix}_floating_point_capabilities_e
${prefix}_floating_point_capabilities_denorm0x1 Denormals supported. ${prefix}_floating_point_capabilities_inf_nan0x2 INF and NaN are supported. ${prefix}_floating_point_capabilities_rte0x4 Round to nearest even supported. ${prefix}_floating_point_capabilities_rtz0x8 Round to zero supported. ${prefix}_floating_point_capabilities_rtp0x10 Round to positive infinity supported. ${prefix}_floating_point_capabilities_rtn0x20 Round to negative infinity supported. ${prefix}_floating_point_capabilities_fma0x40 Fused multiply add supported. ${prefix}_floating_point_capabilities_soft0x80 Floating point operations are written in software. ${prefix}_floating_point_capabilities_full0x100 Binary format conforms to the IEEE-754 specification.
Bitfield of all possible floating point capabilities. Each ${Prefix} device struct has a member which denotes the floating point capabilities of that device, as a bitfield of the following enum.
${prefix}_integer_capabilities_e
${prefix}_integer_capabilities_8bit0x1 8 bit integer support ${prefix}_integer_capabilities_16bit0x2 16 bit integer support ${prefix}_integer_capabilities_32bit0x4 32 bit integer support ${prefix}_integer_capabilities_64bit0x8 64 bit integer support
Bitfield of all possible integer capabilities. Each ${Prefix} device struct has a member which denotes the integer capabilities of that device, as a bitfield of the following enum.
${prefix}_custom_buffer_capabilities_e
${prefix}_custom_buffer_capabilities_data0x1 Custom buffer support for setting `data` and `size` in ${prefix}_descriptor_info_custom_buffer_s. ${prefix}_custom_buffer_capabilities_address_space0x2 Custom buffer support for setting `address_space` in ${prefix}_descriptor_info_custom_buffer_s.
Bitfield of all possible custom buffer capabilities. Each ${Prefix} device struct has a member which denotes the custom buffer capabilities of that device, as a bitfield of the following enum.
${prefix}_endianness_e
${prefix}_endianness_little0x1 Little endian device ${prefix}_endianness_big0x2 Big endian device
All possible endiannesses.
${prefix}_shared_local_memory_type_e
${prefix}_shared_local_memory_physical0 Shared local memory for a device is physical. The shared local memory used by the device is truely that - physical memory on the device.
${prefix}_shared_local_memory_virtual1 Shared local memory for a device is virtual. The shared local memory used by the device is virtual - its actually using the global memory available to the device to pretend that it has shared local memory support.
All possible shared local memory types.
${prefix}_descriptor_info_type_e
${prefix}_descriptor_info_type_buffer0 Descriptor is a buffer. ${prefix}_descriptor_info_type_image1 Descriptor is an image. ${prefix}_descriptor_info_type_sampler2 Descriptor is a sampler. ${prefix}_descriptor_info_type_plain_old_data3 Descriptor is plain-old-data. ${prefix}_descriptor_info_type_shared_local_buffer4 Descriptor is a shared local buffer. ${prefix}_descriptor_info_type_null_buffer5 Descriptor is a null buffer. ${prefix}_descriptor_info_type_custom_buffer6 Descriptor is a custom buffer.
All possible descriptor types. ${prefix}_descriptor_info_s::_type Used to identify which type a descriptor is.
${prefix}_address_mode_e ${prefix}_address_mode_e ${prefix}_address_mode_none Image coordinates must reside within the image dimensions. ${prefix}_address_mode_repeat Out of range image coordinates are wrapped around to a valid range. ${prefix}_address_mode_repeat_mirror Out of range image coordinates are mirrored along image boundaries. ${prefix}_address_mode_clamp Out of range image coordinates are clamped to the border colour. ${prefix}_address_mode_clamp_edge Out of range image coordinates are clamped to the image extent.
All possible addressing modes describing how to handle out of range image coordinates.
${prefix}_filter_mode_e ${prefix}_filter_mode_e ${prefix}_filter_mode_nearest Sample the nearest pixel to the specified coordinate. ${prefix}_filter_mode_linear Sample and blend the neighbouring pixels to the specified coordinate.
All possible filter modes for image sampling.

${prefix}_device_info_s
idmux_id_tThe ID of this device object.
allocation_capabilitiesuint32_t The buffer capabilities of this ${Prefix} device, a bitfield. ${prefix}_allocation_capabilities_e
address_capabilitiesuint32_t The addressing capabilities of this ${Prefix} device, a bitfield. ${prefix}_address_capabilities_e
cache_capabilitiesuint32_t The caching capabilities of this ${Prefix} device, a bitfield. ${prefix}_cache_capabilities_e
half_capabilitiesuint32_t The half floating point capabilities of this ${Prefix} device, a bitfield. ${prefix}_floating_point_capabilities_e
For OpenCL, this value is used to implement clGetDeviceInfo, when asking for CL_DEVICE_HALF_FP_CONFIG.
float_capabilitiesuint32_t The floating point capabilities of this ${Prefix} device, a bitfield. ${prefix}_floating_point_capabilities_e
For OpenCL, this value is used to implement clGetDeviceInfo, when asking for CL_DEVICE_SINGLE_FP_CONFIG.
double_capabilitiesuint32_t The double floating point capabilities of this ${Prefix} device, a bitfield. ${prefix}_floating_point_capabilities_e
For OpenCL, this value is used to implement clGetDeviceInfo, when asking for CL_DEVICE_DOUBLE_FP_CONFIG.
integer_capabilitiesuint32_t The integer capabilities of this ${Prefix} device, a bitfield. ${prefix}_integer_capabilities_e
For OpenCL certain integer support can be optional when emdedded profile is selected. Querying clGetDeviceInfo for CL_DEVICE_EXTENSIONS will return 'cles_khr_int64' in the extension list if longs are supported.
custom_buffer_capabilitiesuint32_t The custom buffer capabilities of this ${Prefix} device, a bitfield. ${prefix}_custom_buffer_capabilities_e
For use in extensions which require customized handling of kernel buffer arguments.
endiannessuint32_t The endianness of this ${Prefix} device. ${prefix}_endianness_e
khronos_vendor_iduint32_t The unique Khronos-allocated vendor ID of this ${Prefix} device. ${PREFIX}_DEVICE_KHRONOS_CODEPLAY_ID This value is assigned by Khronos to all fee-paying implementers of Khronos standards, used primarily to differentiate between different vendor implementations of standards. For ${Prefix}, we allow our partners to return 0 for applications that do not want to advertise that they support any of the Khronos standards, but if a partner does want to be able to tell their own userbase, or use Khronos conformance to any standard as part of any marketing materials, they must either have their own allocated Khronos ID, or use Codeplay's Khronos ID.
For OpenCL, this value is queryable by calling clGetDeviceInfo, asking for CL_DEVICE_VENDOR_ID.
shared_local_memory_typeuint32_t The type of this ${Prefix} device's shared local memory. ${prefix}_shared_local_memory_type_e This value specifies which type an ${Prefix} device's shared local memory is.
For OpenCL, this value is used to implement clGetDeviceInfo, when asking for CL_DEVICE_LOCAL_MEM_TYPE.
device_typeuint32_t The type of this ${Prefix} device. ${prefix}_device_type_e This value specifies which type an ${Prefix} device is. This is used to provide information to users of the various standards that sit above ${Prefix} as to what each device actually is.
For OpenCL, this value is used to implement clGetDeviceInfo, when asking for CL_DEVICE_TYPE.
builtin_kernel_declarationsconst char* A semicolon-separated, null-terminated list of built-in kernel declarations. The declarations are of the form `kernel_name(parameters)`, e.g., `a_kernel(global float* foo, int bar)`. Kernel names and parameters conform to the OpenCL specification for kernel names and kernel parameters with the following exceptions:
1. The leading `__kernel` keyword **must not** be used 2. The return type (`void`) **must** be omitted 3. Pointer parameters using `[]` notation **must not** be used 4. Struct parameters and pointer-to-struct parameters **must not** be used 5. Type and variable attributes (e.g., `__attribute__*`) **must not** be used 6. All whitespace **must** only be ` ` characters; other whitespace characters (`\t`, `\n`, etc.) **must not** be used 7. The built-in kernel name including a trailing NUL character must not exceed `CL_NAME_VERSION_KHR` (64 characters).
Also note that:
1. Pointer-to-pointer parameters are not supported. 2. The `const` and `volatile` type qualifiers are ignored when used with a value parameter. I.e., `const int foo` and `int foo` are equivalent.
device_nameconst char* A null-terminated string, with static lifetime duration, of this ${Prefix} device's name. This value is a human-readable variant of the device_type field. It is used for standards that return a string to users to help them identify whose implementation of a given standard they are using.
For OpenCL, this value is used to implement clGetDeviceInfo, when asking for CL_DEVICE_NAME.
max_concurrent_work_itemsuint32_t The maximum number of work items in a work group that can run concurrently. The maximum number of work items that can inhabit a work/thread group. Various standards refer to work items and work/thread groups using different lingo, but at the heart work items should execute on a given device concurrently, up to this maximum number of work items.
For OpenCL, this value is used to implement clGetDeviceInfo, when asking for CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_GROUP_SIZE.
max_work_group_size_xuint32_t The maximum work group size in the x dimension. The maximum number of work items allowed in the x dimension of a work group.
For OpenCL, this value is used to implement clGetDeviceInfo, when asking for CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_ITEM_SIZES.
max_work_group_size_yuint32_t The maximum work group size in the y dimension. The maximum number of work items allowed in the y dimension of a work group.
For OpenCL, this value is used to implement clGetDeviceInfo, when asking for CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_ITEM_SIZES.
max_work_group_size_zuint32_t The maximum work group size in the z dimension. The maximum number of work items allowed in the z dimension of a work group.
For OpenCL, this value is used to implement clGetDeviceInfo, when asking for CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_ITEM_SIZES.
max_work_widthuint32_t The maximum work width. The maximum number of work items of a work group allowed to execute in one invocation of a kernel.
clock_frequencyuint32_t The clock frequency (in MHz) of this ${Prefix} device. Used for standards that want to know the frequency of the chip they are going to execute with.
For OpenCL, this value is used to implement clGetDeviceInfo, when asking for CL_DEVICE_MAX_CLOCK_FREQUENCY.
compute_unitsuint32_t The number of compute units in this ${Prefix} device. Used for standards that want to know how many distinct compute units make up a given ${Prefix} device.
For OpenCL, this value is used to implement clGetDeviceInfo, when asking for CL_DEVICE_MAX_COMPUTE_UNITS.
buffer_alignmentuint32_t The alignment (in bytes) of buffer's allocated via this device. Used for standards that need to know what alignment buffer objects will have in device memory. Must be a power of 2.
For OpenCL, this value is used to implement clGetDeviceInfo, when asking for CL_DEVICE_MIN_DATA_TYPE_ALIGN_SIZE.
memory_sizeuint64_t The size (in bytes) of our device memory. Used for standards that want to know the total size of memory allocatable from each device.
For OpenCL, this value is used to implement clGetDeviceInfo, when asking for CL_DEVICE_GLOBAL_MEM_SIZE.
allocation_sizeuint64_t The maximum size (in bytes) of a single device memory allocation. Used for standards that want to know the maximum size of a single memory allocation from each device. For some devices this value may be the same as memory_size, i.e. there is no single allocation limit beyond the total memory capacity.
For OpenCL, this value is used to implement clGetDeviceInfo, when asking for CL_DEVICE_MAX_MEM_ALLOC_SIZE. For OpenCL full profile a minimum value of 128MiB (128*1024*1024) will be required, for embedded profile a minimum value of 1MiB (1*1024*1024) will be required.
@note Although OpenCL also generally calculates maximum allocation size as 1/4 of total memory size, this is *not* required here, it is the OpenCL implementation's responsibility to consider such things.
cache_sizeuint64_t The size (in bytes) of our device memory cache. Used for standards that want to know the total size of memory that is cached by the device.
For OpenCL, this value is used to implement clGetDeviceInfo, when asking for CL_DEVICE_GLOBAL_MEM_CACHE_SIZE.
cacheline_sizeuint64_t The size (in bytes) of our device memory cache line. Used for standards that want to know the total size of memory that is held, in each line of a cache, by the device.
For OpenCL, this value is used to implement clGetDeviceInfo, when asking for CL_DEVICE_GLOBAL_MEM_CACHELINE_SIZE.
shared_local_memory_sizeuint64_t The size (in bytes) of our shared local device memory. Used for standards that want to know the total size of memory allocatable in shared local memory from each device.
For OpenCL, this value is used to implement clGetDeviceInfo, when asking for CL_DEVICE_LOCAL_MEM_SIZE.
native_vector_widthuint32_t Native vector width of the device (in bytes).For OpenCL, this value is used to implement clGetDeviceInfo, when asking for all of the CL_DEVICE_NATIVE_VECTOR_WIDTH_* queries. preferred_vector_widthuint32_t Preferred vector width of the device (in bytes).For OpenCL, this value is used to implement clGetDeviceInfo, when asking for all of the CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_* queries.
image_supportboolIs @p true if the device supports images, @p false otherwise. image2d_array_writesboolIs @p true if the device supports 2D image array writes, @p false otherwise. image3d_writesboolIs @p true if the device supports 3D image writes, @p false otherwise. max_image_dimension_1duint32_t The maximum dimension size in pixels for a one dimensional image, zero if images are not supported. max_image_dimension_2duint32_t The maximum dimension size in pixels for a two dimensional image, zero if images are not supported. max_image_dimension_3duint32_t The maximum dimension size in pixels for a three dimensional image, zero if images are not supported. max_image_array_layersuint32_t The maximum array layers count for an image array, zero if images are not supported. max_storage_imagesuint32_t The maximum number of bound images for image storage (write), zero if images are not supported. max_sampled_imagesuint32_t The maximum number of bound images for image sampling (read), zero if images are not supported. max_samplersuint32_t The maximum number of bound samplers, zero if images are not supported.
queue_types[${prefix}_queue_type_total]uint32_t The number of queues of each type that are available with this device.
device_priorityint8_t The priority of devices on the system for deciding which should be default device. This value is used for tracking device priority when deciding which devices shall be returned if `CL_DEVICE_TYPE_DEFAULT` is requested. Host will have a value of `0` where higher priority devices will be in the positive range and conversely a lower priority for the negative range.
query_counter_supportboolIf `true` the device supports `${prefix}_query_type_counter`, `false` otherwise. descriptors_updatableboolIf `true` the device supports updating the `${prefix}_device_info_t` argument descriptors passed to a specialized kernel in a `${prefix}CommandNDRange` command after the containing `${prefix}_command_buffer` has been finalized. can_clone_command_buffersboolIf `true` the device supports cloning `${prefix}_command_buffers` via the `${prefix}CloneCommandBuffer` entry point. supports_builtin_kernelsboolIf `true` the device supports creating built-in kernels via the `${prefix}CreateBuiltInKernel` entry point. max_sub_group_countuint32_tThe maximum number of sub-groups in a work-group. A target not supporting sub-groups must set this to `0`. sub_groups_support_ifpboolIf `true` the device supports independent forward progress in its sub-groups. A target not supporting sub-groups must set this to `false`. max_hardware_countersuint32_tMaximum number of hardware counters that can be active at one time. supports_work_group_collectivesboolBoolean value indicating if work-group collective functions are supported by the device. supports_generic_address_spaceboolBoolean value indicating if the generic address space is supported by the device. num_sub_group_sizessize_tThe number of sub-group sizes supported by the device, pointed to by sub_group_sizes. sub_group_sizessize_t*List of sub-group sizes supported by the device, sized by num_sub_group_sizes.
${Prefix}'s device information container. Holds details about a partner device, allowing the access to them without initializing that device.
${prefix}_device_s
idmux_id_tThe ID of this device object, matches the device info ID. infomux_device_info_tThe information associated with this device.
${Prefix}'s device container. The entry struct into all partner code - the device. Each partner must register at least one device (by defining hooks of type coreGetDeviceInfos_t and coreCreateDevices_t). All other partner code is interfaced with through instances of this device struct.

The bitfield must have at least one bit set, for implementations with only one heap the first bit must be set.
Description of the device memory requirements of a buffer or an image.

For memory objects with the ${prefix}_memory_property_host_visible property this is a host accessible pointer.
